intro: Staphylea yuanjiangensis, commonly known as the Yujiang staphylea, is a rare flowering plant native to China. It belongs to the family Staphyleaceae and is characterized by its distinctive, clustered flowers that resemble small bells. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments, often in mountainous regions. Its leaves are alternate and ovate, with a smooth texture, while its fruits are capsule-like and contain several seeds. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a species of conservation concern.
